page.title: 15Private Health and Care
page.content: The{Winterborne Hospital}was built in 1982 and opened by Patrick Jenkin. It could then take 20 patients, but now 30 can be treated.It has an operating theatre and all patients have single rooms.The hospital was built because of the loss of private beds in the local NHS hospitals. The{West Dorset Hospice Charity}was begun in 1983 when an appeal was launched. The idea was to care for cancer patients in their own home. Two Macmillan nurses now work in the community. They provide treatment for patients and help for their families at a difficult time. There are three private{residential {homes for the elderly}in this area. People who can no longer care for themselves, are looked after in large houses which have been specially converted.
